'''Maractus''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''マラカッチ''' ''Maracacchi'') is a {{type|Grass}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It is not known to [[Evolution|evolve]] into or from any other Pokémon.

==Biology==
Maractus is a cactus-like Pokémon, with large ear-like extensions. These extensions feature dark green spiky arrangements at the base, yellow spikes further up, and flowers, with pink petals and yellow centers, at the top. It has a yellow spike on its head, yellow eyes and a spiky-looking mouth. Other dark green spiky arrangements adorn its neck, the wrists of its yellow-fingered arms, and base. Its base features further such green spikes arranged in a five-pointed star.

When Maractus moves its body rhythmically, it emits sounds reminiscent of maracas being played. This allows Maractus to produce up-tempo songs and dances that it can use to scare away predators. Avian Pokémon in particular may try to feed on its flower seeds.

Maractus live in arid regions and dry [[desert]]-like areas.

==In the anime==
[[File:Marra and Racca.png|thumb|250px|left|Maractus in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Three Maractus appeared in ''[[BW053|A Maractus Musical!]]'', under the ownership of [[Toby]]. They performed in a [[Pokémon Musical]] and were also used in a [[Triple Battle]] against {{Ash}}, where they battled {{AP|Pikachu}}, {{AP|Tepig}}, and {{AP|Snivy}}. They were given the [[nickname]]s Marra, Racca, and Tussy.

A Maractus appeared in ''[[BW112|Team Plasma's Pokémon Power Plot!]]''.

===Minor appearances===
A Maractus made a cameo appearance in ''[[BW069|Climbing the Tower of Success!]]''.

A Maractus appeared in a fantasy in ''[[BW080|Clash of the Connoisseurs!]]''.

A Maractus appeared in ''[[M15|Kyurem VS. The Sword of Justice]]'', during the {{OBP|Swords of Justice|M15}} legend.

A Maractus appeared in ''[[BW117|Team Plasma's Pokémon Manipulation!]]''.

A Trainer's Maractus appeared in ''[[BW125|Cilan and the Case of the Purrloin Witness!]]''.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Maractus was used by a {{tc|Team Plasma Grunt}} in ''[[PS481|Sandstorm]]''. It, together with its Trainer, were easily defeated by [[Grimsley]] and his {{p|Bisharp}}.

A Maractus appeared in ''[[PS483|Special Delivery]]'' as one of the Pokémon competing in {{ci|Nimbasa}}'s [[Pokémon Musical]].

==Trivia==
* Maractus is the only Pokémon with a base stat total of 461.
* Maractus shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Cacnea}}. They are both known as the Cactus Pokémon.
* Two of Maractus's [[Ability|Abilities]] revolve around how a real-world cactus stores water with great efficiency: {{a|Water Absorb}} absorbs direct damage from {{type|Water}} moves to restore health from them as well as making it immune to them, while {{a|Storm Drain}} draws in {{type|Water}} moves directed at another target, also making it immune.
* Although Maractus can only be found at the [[Desert Resort]] in [[Generation V]] where a permanent {{weather|sandstorm}} rages, it cannot have any Ability negating sandstorm damage, nor is it {{t|Rock}}-, {{t|Ground}}-, or {{type|Steel}}, and thus it is susceptible to damage by the sandstorm.

===Origin===
Maractus appears to be based on a flowering cactus, most likely the {{wp|Opuntia|prickly pear}}, and a {{wp|maraca}}. It also physically resembles a {{wp|rabbit}} and may be a visual pun on the {{wp|Opuntia microdasys|bunny ears cactus}}. It also seems to be based on traditional Mexican dress styles and, due to the fact that it dances and makes maraca-like sounds, may be based on Spanish dances, possibly the Mexican version of the Cuban {{wp|Son (music)|Son}}.

====Name origin====
Maractus may be a combination of ''{{wp|maraca}}'' and ''{{wp|cactus}}''.

Maracacchi may be a combination of ''maraca'', ''cactus'' and ''{{wp|mariachi}}''.
